channel.title: Wich vps would be good for a new server please help
channel.description:
Idk all the good vps hosters so I've been looking online and found this 1 idk if its cheap can someone tell me ??
host-it.co.uk/vps/windows-virtual-private-servers.asp
Ty guys u could be saving me money ;P

item.title: Wich vps would be good for a new server please help
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

burst.net - cheap, reliable and fast VPSs, using one now. Really good for the price.

Read full topic
item.source: Wich vps would be good for a new server please help

item.title: Wich vps would be good for a new server please help
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

Those prices aren’t really that decent, you can get them for half that if you go to the right place.

But ideally, you want at LEAST 512MB of Ram, 1GB is Recommended though…
Any more is a bonus…

As for QUOTA/Disk space, it depends how many players you have, but 5GB should be suffice, anything extra is a bonus, haha.

As for bandwidth, 50GB should be enough for a starting server, you can always upgrade if it’s not enough, or theres sometimes options to allow for ‘overuse’ which means you pay a certain price (set by the host) for every 1GB (usually), sometimes measured in MB, that you go over your allocated bandwidth.

You should also try and go with a trusted host, however their prices are slightly higher.
If you’re on a low budget, you can always try a newer host, in which case it would be supporting the webhosting industry a little more, you’d get it cheaper and probably more for your money, however they may not be as experienced, so expect a little bit of downtime (usually not a lot)… and make sure they don’t ‘cram’ your VPS into another server with about 5293952459349539 different other VPS’s on it, meaning your servers often shared with other people, slowing it down…

Read full topic
item.source: Wich vps would be good for a new server please help
